But if user tries after sometime, he is able to log in into confluence.

fields.description:
The new autocomplete work released in 4.1.2 that allows you to insert a macro after typing } doesn't work if you're in a list.

See http://screencast.com/t/bLpDwwBdrwM7
fields.summary: Autocomplete in lists
Suggest colours for panel macro
Split Edit and Restrict permissions on page level
Improve Tasklist Macro with the ability to insert JIRA issues
Keyboard shortcuts for text alignment

fields.description:
h3.Problem If you are accessing Confluence through a URL other than the URL set as [Base URL|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+the+Server+Base+URL] and try to insert GreenHopper gadget, the gadget's height is displayed incorrectly. See the screen shots: Confluence Base URL !^Base URL.png|thumbnail! Gadget accessing with the wrong URL !^Gadget wrong URL.png|thumbnail! Gadget accessing with the correct URL !^Gadget correct URL.png|thumbnail! h5. Note that the HTML code generated is different between both URLs: Gadget accessing with the wrong URL, with Firebug activated !^Gadget wrong URL firebug.png|thumbnail! This is the HTML code generated by the wrong URL: {code:html}
{code} Gadget accessing with the correct URL, with Firebug activated !^Gadget correct URL firebug.png|thumbnail! This is the HTML code generated by the correct URL: {code:html}
{code} Using the wrong URL this parameter is missing: *style="height: 372px;"* h3.Fix There is none yet. h3.Workaround Access Confluence using the correct base URL.
fields.summary: When inserting GreenHopper gadget on Confluence, the gadget's height is displayed incorrectly

We're working on a cross-product plugin and I just wanted it to run in Confluence. After executing {{atlas-run --product confluence --version 4.1.3}} My build fails because of a missing zip file on the atlassian maven repository

{code}[INFO] Configured Artifact: com.atlassian.confluence.plugins:confluence-plugin-test-resources:LATEST:zip

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------{code}

The other versions seems to have a zip file, so my guess it's missing ;-)

I already have a work around by using {{--data-version}} but making sure there is a proper zip located at the location seems a better fix, as it defaults to LATEST, I can't be the only developer having this issue. fields.description:
This is a clone of [CWD-2494].

In attached log you can see a synchronisation start at 2011-06-01 15:42:59,076 and "time-out" for 120 second timeout at 2011-06-01 15:43:15,739

*Bug description*

In this bug, a read timeout exception is thrown before the timeout has passed. In the log snippet below, read timeout exception was thrown only around 300 milliseconds after last successful LDAP operation:
{code}
2011-06-01 15:43:15,400 QuartzWorker-1 INFO ServiceRunner     [directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher] found [ 210 ] remote user-group memberships in [ 317ms ]
2011-06-01 15:43:15,715 QuartzWorker-1 INFO ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] synchronisation complete in [ 16639ms ]
2011-06-01 15:43:15,739 QuartzWorker-1 ERROR ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller] Error occurred while refreshing the cache for directory [ 10000 ].
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationFailedException: org.springframework.ldap.UncategorizedLdapException: Uncategorized exception occured during LDAP processing; nested exception is javax.naming.NamingException: LDAP response read timed out, timeout used:120000ms.; remaining name 'cn=c-user-1593,ou=childou-c-2000users,ou=loadtesting10k,o=sgi,c=us'
{code}

*Cause*

This bug is triggered randomly in some environments, when the Read Timeout field in LDAP directory properties has been set to non-zero value.

This bug is caused by a known [bug (#6968459)|http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=6968459] affecting Java SE.

*Workaround*

Normally these exceptions can be safely ignored as the synchronisation is self-correcting. That is, problems encountered in one synchronisation round will get fixed in the following synchronisation round.

If the synchronisation fails to complete successfully repeatedly, a known workaround is to disable read timeout by setting the Read Timeout field in LDAP directory properties to 0. A side-effect of this change is that Crowd will not be able to recover automatically from LDAP requests that take too long to run, which might cause Crowd to stop communicating with LDAP directories until it is restarted.
fields.summary: LDAP Synchronisation can fail unexpectedly due to mistiming in the "LDAP response read time out"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24442].
  {panel}

As a document author, I would like to specify that a Confluence page should look "pretty" and render gracefully even if a given macro does not exist.

Scenario 1:
* I use a macro *myMacro* on a page. It looks beautiful. For example, the HTML macro.
* Some time later, the administrator disables the macro. The page looks a mess.

Scenario 2:
* My Confluence site uses a given plugin, which supplies *myMacro*.
* The site's license for that plugin expires. It takes a day or two before the administrator gets a new license.
* All pages that use *myMacro* look bad, and are even unreadable, until the new license is installed.

Scenario 3:
* I write some content on my Confluence site. I use *myMacro*, which is installed on my site.
* A customer copies my content and installs it on their own Confluence site. That site does not have the necessary plugin installed.

As the page author, I would like to control the way Confluence behaves when a macro is used on the page. If it suits my purpose, I would like to say that the macro should fail gracefully.

Note that this functionality cannot go into the macro itself, because Confluence will not process that macro.

*One possible solution:*

(This is just one way of solving the problem. There are probably others.)

Confluence could supply a macro *Graceful Macro Fail* (bundled with the product) that the author could add to a page, stating that a specific macro should fail gracefully. For example, from the above scenarios I would want *myMacro* to fail gracefully.

The *Graceful Macro Fail* macro could offer the following parameters:
* Show or hide macro body, if macro does not exist.
* Other text to display, instead of the macro body, if macro does not exist.
* A title to display if macro does not exist.

Note that there may be more than one macro on a page that needs to fail gracefully. There may even be more than one occurrence of the same macro, *myMacro*. For that reason, I need to wrap *myMacro* inside *Graceful Macro Fail*.

*Specific use case:*

We are thinking of adding some sort of conditional processing to our Confluence pages. This may involve a custom macro. We also need to allow other people to copy our content to their own site. The customers' sites will probably not have the custom macro installed.
fields.summary: Allow a macro to fail gracefully if the macro/plugin is not installed on a given Confluence site

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24432].
  {panel}

Writing a Confluence plugin that works across multiple versions of Confluence can be a bit of a challenge. Especially when the Confluence developers accidentally ship changes that break binary compatibility in point releases.

The JIRA developers recently spent a lot of time in JIRA 5 solving this problem by moving the "blessed" Java API for JIRA into a separate API jar. 

Having a clearly-defined API gives plugin developers the confidence to know which services and methods they can call safely without fear of things changing underneath them.

It also gives confidence to Confluence developers to know which areas of the code they can change freely, and which areas need to be changed with care to ensure continuing compatibility.
fields.summary: Define a clear Java API for Confluence plugin developers that won't break when new versions of Confluence are released

fields.description: When editing an existing page's bulleted list, if you create a new bulleted item at the end of a line that has preformatted text, it doesn't reset the style to paragraph but keeps the style as preformatted.  You cannot select the text and set it to paragraph, it doesn't work either.  The expected behavior is for it to reset the text to paragraph style on each new line.  If you first select the text and tell it that it is preformatted and then select paragraph it seems to reset it.  There are multiple issues here, maybe caused by multiple bugs.  See attached movie.

  {panel}

The 'Mention' autocomplete seems to only work on Full Name. In the other hand, 'Share Page' autocomplete works on both Full Name and Username. 

It'd be nice if the 'Mention' autocomplete can also work on User Name since there are some users that depends on username rather than full name. If this is a bit too much for 'mention', perhaps providing a switch option whether to use username vs. fullname vs. the both for its autocomplete would help.

h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new user:
Username: username
Full Name: Full Name
# Wait until it gets indexed correctly
# Try the difference in 'Share Page' autocomplete vs. 'Mention' autocomplete.
fields.summary: Include User Name in Mention Autocomplete in addition to Full Name
Emoticons :P and :D should be abolished

fields.description:
- Create a small table, e.g. 2x3
- Enter text in the second row, in both columns.
- Mark both colums using the mouse.
- Change color to, lets say, grey.

Result:
The selected cells are offset by one cell horizontally, resulting in the first column to become removed and the table getting an additional column at the end for just this row.
So the table changes shape and jets a ragged outline (see screenshot)
fields.summary: Changing color in more than one table cell breaks table layout

fields.description:
One page was editable by all users with the Add permission then one user was able to go through the entire edit process, save page, but none of the changes were being saved.  It still reported that the user was the last user to edit the page but not of his edits persisted.  

We then copied the page to his personal space and the problem persisted.

After adding the Remove permission for the user he was then able to edit the page.
fields.summary: Page failed to allow user with Add permission to edit the page
Track the users that I've shared a page with in a log or other record
